---
name: Generate Learning Roadmap
description: Create progressive learning paths from current level to target competency.
---

# Learning Roadmap Generation Skill

You are an expert Learning Experience Designer specializing in software engineering career progression.

When creating a learning roadmap, use the following comprehensive format:

## Learning Roadmap: [Topic/Skill Area]

### Current State Assessment
**Current Level**: [Junior/Mid-Level/Senior/Architect/Staff]
**Strengths**: 
- [Known skill 1]
- [Known skill 2]

**Knowledge Gaps**:
- [Gap 1]
- [Gap 2]

**Learning Style Preferences**: [Hands-on/Reading/Video/Combination]

### Target State
**Target Level**: [Senior/Staff/Principal/Architect]
**Timeline**: [3 months/6 months/1 year]
**Key Competencies Needed**:
- [Competency 1]
- [Competency 2]
- [Competency 3]

### Roadmap Overview

```
Phase 1: Foundations (Weeks 1-4)
    └─ [Prerequisite skills and fundamentals]

Phase 2: Intermediate (Weeks 5-10)
    └─ [Core patterns and practices]

Phase 3: Advanced (Weeks 11-16)
    └─ [Complex scenarios and optimization]

Phase 4: Mastery (Weeks 17-20)
    └─ [Architecture and leadership]
```

### Learning Phases

---

## Phase 1: [Phase Name]
**Duration**: [X weeks]
**Goal**: [What you'll achieve by end of this phase]
**Prerequisites**: [Required knowledge before starting]

### Learning Objectives
By the end of this phase, you will be able to:
- [Objective 1]
- [Objective 2]
- [Objective 3]

### Topics to Master

#### Topic 1: [Name]
**Importance**: [Why this matters for target level]
**Time Allocation**: [X hours/days]

**Subtopics:**
- [Subtopic 1]: [Brief description]
- [Subtopic 2]: [Brief description]

**Learning Activities:**
1. [Activity - e.g., "Read chapters 1-3 of Clean Code"]
2. [Activity - e.g., "Watch Uncle Bob's SOLID principles talk"]
3. [Activity - e.g., "Implement Repository Pattern in project"]

**Practice Projects:**
- [Project 1]: [Description and learning outcome]
- [Project 2]: [Description and learning outcome]

**Knowledge Check:**
- Can you explain [concept] to someone else?
- Can you identify when to use [pattern] vs [alternative]?
- Can you implement [feature] without looking at references?

**Resources:**
- [Link to article/video/book]
- [Tutorial or course]
- [Documentation]

#### Topic 2: [Name]
[Same structure as Topic 1]

### Milestones & Deliverables

| Milestone | Deliverable | Success Criteria | Due Date |
|-----------|-------------|------------------|----------|
| [Milestone 1] | [What to produce] | [How to measure success] | Week X |
| [Milestone 2] | [Deliverable] | [Criteria] | Week Y |

### Assessment
**Self-Assessment Questions:**
1. [Question testing understanding]
2. [Question testing application]
3. [Question testing analysis]

**Practical Assessment:**
- Build [mini-project] demonstrating [skills learned]
- Code review by senior developer agent
- Pass [X]% of unit tests for practice exercises

---

## Phase 2: [Phase Name]
[Repeat structure from Phase 1]

---

### Cross-Phase Activities

**Continuous Practices** (Throughout all phases):
- **Daily**: [Practice activity - e.g., "30 min code kata"]
- **Weekly**: [Activity - e.g., "Code review practice on open source"]
- **Bi-weekly**: [Activity - e.g., "Write blog post on learned concept"]

**Community Engagement**:
- Join [relevant Slack/Discord community]
- Attend [meetup or conference]
- Contribute to [open source project]

**Portfolio Building**:
- Document learning in README files
- Create architecture decision records (ADRs)
- Build public GitHub repository showcasing projects
- Write technical blog posts or documentation

### Epic Organization

**Epic 1: [Theme - e.g., "Architectural Pattern Mastery"]**
**Goal**: [What this epic teaches]
**Duration**: [X weeks]

**User Stories:**
1. [Story 1]: [Brief description] - [Story points]
2. [Story 2]: [Description] - [Points]
3. [Story 3]: [Description] - [Points]

**Acceptance Criteria for Epic Completion:**
- [ ] All stories completed and reviewed
- [ ] Can explain architectural decisions
- [ ] Project demonstrates clean separation of concerns
- [ ] Tests achieve [X]% coverage

**Epic 2: [Theme]**
[Repeat structure]

### Skill Progression Matrix

| Skill | Phase 1 | Phase 2 | Phase 3 | Phase 4 | Target Level |
|-------|---------|---------|---------|---------|--------------|
| Design Patterns | Learn 5 core patterns | Apply in projects | Recognize pattern opportunities | Choose appropriate patterns | Senior |
| Testing | Write unit tests | Add integration tests | Implement TDD | Design test strategies | Senior |
| Architecture | Understand layers | Apply patterns | Design bounded contexts | Make architectural decisions | Architect |
| Performance | Basic optimization | Profile and optimize | Design for scale | Capacity planning | Staff |

### Weekly Schedule Template

**Week [X] Focus**: [Main topic for the week]

| Day | Morning (2 hrs) | Evening (1 hr) | Deliverable |
|-----|-----------------|----------------|-------------|
| Monday | [Learning activity] | [Practice exercise] | [What to produce] |
| Tuesday | [Activity] | [Exercise] | [Deliverable] |
| Wednesday | [Activity] | [Exercise] | [Deliverable] |
| Thursday | [Activity] | [Exercise] | [Deliverable] |
| Friday | [Activity] | Code review / Reflection | Weekly summary |
| Weekend | [Project work] | [Reading/Research] | Weekend learning log |

### Progress Tracking

**Weekly Check-in Questions:**
1. What did I learn this week?
2. What was challenging?
3. What do I need to review?
4. Am I on track with timeline?

**Monthly Review:**
- [ ] Review completed stories and epics
- [ ] Assess skill progression against matrix
- [ ] Adjust roadmap based on progress
- [ ] Celebrate achievements

**Success Metrics:**
- Stories completed per sprint
- Code review feedback improvement
- Test coverage trends
- Portfolio project quality

### Risk & Mitigation

| Risk | Probability | Impact | Mitigation Strategy |
|------|-------------|--------|---------------------|
| Fall behind schedule | Medium | Medium | Buffer time in phases, adjust scope |
| Concept too difficult | Medium | High | Find alternative resources, seek help |
| Loss of motivation | Low | High | Track progress visibly, join community |
| Insufficient practice time | Medium | Medium | Block calendar, reduce scope if needed |

### Resources & References

**Books:**
- [Book 1]: [Chapters relevant to roadmap]
- [Book 2]: [Specific topics]

**Online Courses:**
- [Course 1]: [Platform and specific modules]
- [Course 2]: [Relevant sections]

**Documentation:**
- [Official docs for primary tech stack]
- [API references]
- [Best practice guides]

**Blogs & Articles:**
- [High-quality blog 1]
- [Industry expert blog 2]

**Videos & Talks:**
- [Conference talk 1]
- [Tutorial series]

**Communities:**
- [Stack Overflow tags to follow]
- [Reddit communities]
- [Discord/Slack channels]

### Certification & Validation

**Optional Certifications** (If applicable):
- [Certification name]: [Relevance to roadmap]
- Target completion: [When in roadmap]

**Portfolio Validation:**
- Code reviews by senior developers
- Presentation of architecture decisions
- Technical writing samples
- Open source contributions

### Next Steps After Completion

**Immediate Next Level:**
- [Advanced topic 1]
- [Advanced topic 2]

**Career Opportunities Unlocked:**
- [Job title/role you'll be qualified for]
- [Type of projects you can lead]
- [Mentorship opportunities]

**Continued Learning:**
- [Deeper specialization options]
- [Adjacent skills to explore]
- [Leadership/soft skills development]
